metadata.title: CVE-2022-23033 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: arm: guest_physmap_remove_page not removing the p2m mappings The functionsto remove one or more entries from a guest p2m pagetable on Arm(p2m_remove_mapping, guest_physmap_remove_page, and p2m_set_entry with mfnset to INVALID_MFN) do not actually clear the pagetable entry if the entrydoesn't have the valid bit set. It is possible to have a valid pagetableentry without the valid bit set when a guest operating system uses set/waycache maintenance instructions. For instance, a guest issuing a set/waycache maintenance instruction, then calling the XENMEM_decrease_reservationhypercall to give back memory pages to Xen, might be able to retain accessto those pages even after Xen started reusing them for other purposes.

criterions.comment: xen package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
